title: Bolivia Heads to First Run-Off as Centrist Paz Leads Presidential Vote
snippets: A dark horse centrist, Sen. Rodrigo Paz, drew more votes than the right-wing front-runners, although not enough to secure an outright victory, early results showed.
Early results show centrist Rodrigo Paz in the lead, with 32.8 percent of the vote.
Bolivians voted in elections overshadowed by the worst economic crisis in four decades. Early exit polls show that the first round ended 20 years of leftist rule in the country.

First-round result marks the end of nearly 20 years of dominance by the leftist Movimiento al Socialismo as economic crisis grips the country

Bolivia’s presidential election will go to a run-off for the first time, with
titles: Bolivia's presidential vote goes to runoff between centrist and right-wing candidates
Bolivia to hold presidential run-off between centrist and right-winger
Bolivia's elections headed for first presidential runoff
Bolivia presidential election: preliminary results put two rightwing candidates in run-off vote
summary: In Bolivia's presidential election, centrist Senator Rodrigo Paz led with 32.8% of the vote, signaling a potential end to nearly 20 years of leftist governance amid the country's worst economic crisis in decades. However, Paz did not secure enough votes for an outright victory, necessitating a run-off. This election marks the first time Bolivia will go to a run-off, indicating a significant political shift as the Movimiento al Socialismo's long-standing dominance is challenged.

title: Air Canada to Resume Flights Amid Ongoing Strike, 100K+ Passengers Stranded
snippets: Air Canada will resume flights Monday evening, claiming the union illegally directed flight attendants to defy a return-to-work order.
Air Canada said it would delay its plans to restart operations to Monday evening. Some 100,000 people have been stranded amid flight cancellations.

Union to challenge order issued less than 12 hours after start of action that has left more than 100,000 travellers stranded

Air Canada’s flight attendants plan to remain on strike, their union has said, defying government efforts to force them back to work and into binding arbitration over
The decision by the union representing the 10,000 workers means that travel chaos will continue for at least a second day. Air Canada said it had suspended its reopening plan until Monday evening.
The shutdown of Canada’s largest airline early Saturday was impacting about 130,000 people a day. Air Canada operates around 700 flights per day.
titles: Air Canada suspends restart plans after union defies return to work order
Air Canada strike: Cabin crew defy return to work order
Air Canada flight attendants to defy back-to-work order and remain on strike
Air Canada Flight Attendants Say They Will Defy Back-to-Work Order
Air Canada flight attendants defy return-to-work order, forcing airline to delay plans to resume flights
summary: Air Canada announced plans to resume flights on Monday evening after a strike by flight attendants, represented by CUPE, led to widespread cancellations, affecting around 130,000 passengers daily. The union has defied a federal back-to-work order, challenging its legality and continuing strikes for better wages, causing significant travel disruptions. This defiance comes despite Air Canada’s attempt to restart operations, leaving over 100,000 people stranded. The situation remains unresolved as the union and Air Canada navigate the ongoing dispute.

title: EU, NATO Leaders to Meet Trump, Zelenskyy in Washington for Ukraine Peace Talks
snippets: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte are among those expected to attend.
US envoy says Putin agreed at summit for Ukraine to have security guarantee from allies similar to NATO’s Article 5.
Trump tells Zelenskyy on the eve of the meeting to give up Crimea and on the notion of joining NATO. European leaders will join Zelenskyy in Washington to shore up his position. DW has the latest.

The talks, prompted by a recent summit between Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska, will explore U.S. security guarantees for Ukraine. The meeting comes amid criticisms of Putin's refusal to agree to a ceasefire, with Zelenskyy noting this stance complicates peace efforts. European allies, notably Emmanue

title: Scheffler Wins BMW Championship, Overcoming MacIntyre's Lead
snippets: World number one Scottie Scheffler eats up Robert MacIntyre's overnight lead of four shots to win the BMW Championship.
The Scot shot three-over par in the final round which allowed Scheffler to come through for victory

• MacIntyre never recovers after bogeys on first two holes

  • Scheffler has five PGA titles for second year in a row

Bob MacIntyre blew a four-shot lead in the final round as the world No 1, Scottie Scheffler, produced a moment of magic to clinch victory at the B
Scottie Scheffler claimed a fifth victory of the PGA Tour season after Robert MacIntyre squandered a four-shot lead during the final round of the BMW Championship.
titles: MacIntyre 'wants to smash up clubs' as Scheffler wins
Robert MacIntyre blows four-shot lead as Scottie Scheffler wins BMW Championship
Bob MacIntyre blows four-shot lead as Scheffler wins BMW Championship
MacIntyre blows big lead as Scheffler snatches impressive PGA Tour win
summary: Scottie Scheffler, the world number one golfer, overcame Robert MacIntyre's four-shot lead to win the BMW Championship. MacIntyre's early bogeys in the final round contributed to his inability to maintain the lead. This victory marks Scheffler's fifth PGA Tour win of the season, achieving this feat for the second consecutive year.

title: European Leaders to Discuss Ukraine Security with Zelensky in Washington
snippets: European leaders will join Ukraine’s president in US as he comes under pressure to concede territory to Russia
European leaders, including from Britain, France and Germany, will join as Trump meets Zelensky in Washington after his Alaska summit with Putin.
President Trump offered security guarantees to deter future Russian aggression. But the offer was vague, prompting Kyiv to seek clarity.
titles: Zelenskyy and allies to press Trump on security guarantees
Amid pressure on Zelensky to make deal, U.S. to offer some security guarantees
Ukraine Weighs Trump’s Offer of Security Guarantees With Caution
summary: European leaders from Britain, France, and Germany will meet with Ukraine's President Zelensky in Washington during his visit, following President Trump's summit with Putin in Alaska. Trump has offered Ukraine security guarantees to prevent future Russian aggression, but the specifics of these guarantees remain unclear, leading Kyiv to request further details. This meeting comes as Zelensky faces pressure to cede territory to Russia.

title: Cambridge Dictionary Adds 6,000 New Words, Showcasing TikTok Influence
snippets: More than 6,000 new terms feature, including some relating to remote working and rich tech giants.
The latest additions to the world's largest online dictionary, among 6,000 others, show how much internet culture is changing the English language.

Lexicographers give nod to TikTok generation’s enduring influence on English language with latest additions

“Skibidi”, “tradwife” and “delulu” are among the new words to have made this year’s Cambridge Dictionary in a selection that confirms the increasing influence of the TikTok generation
titles: 'Skibidi' and 'tradwife' among words added to Cambridge Dictionary
'Skibidi', 'delulu', and 'tradwife' make their way into Cambridge Dictionary
‘Skibidi’, ‘delulu’ and ‘tradwife’ among words added to Cambridge Dictionary
summary: The Cambridge Dictionary has added over 6,000 new terms, reflecting the significant influence of the TikTok generation on the English language. Among the new entries are words related to remote working, tech giants, and terms like "skibidi", "tradwife", and "delulu". This update highlights the evolving nature of language and the impact of digital culture.

title: Mass Protests in Tel Aviv Demand End to War, Hostage Release
snippets: Large crowds fill 'Hostages Square' in Tel Aviv to call for fighting to cease and the release of all remaining hostages by Hamas.
Protests have been held across Israel as the government continues its war against Hamas. The US says it is suspending visas for "individuals from Gaza."

One of largest rallies in Israel since start of conflict follows general strike to press government to stop military action

Tens of thousands of demonstrators have gathered in Tel Aviv to call for an end to the war in Gaza and the release of hostages, one of the largest demonstrations in Is
titles: Huge crowds gather in Israel calling for hostage deal and end to Gaza war
Middle East: Israel protests call for hostage deal, end to war
Tens of thousands of protesters gather in Tel Aviv to demand end to Gaza war
summary: Tens of thousands of demonstrators filled Hostages Square in Tel Aviv, one of the largest rallies in Israel since the start of the conflict, calling for an end to the war against Hamas and the release of all remaining hostages. The protest, which followed a general strike, is part of wider protests across Israel against the government's military action in Gaza. Meanwhile, the US has responded to the situation by suspending visas for individuals from Gaza.

title: Jaguars Trade Fortner to Saints for DT Saunders
snippets: The Jaguars have acquired veteran defensive tackle Khalen Saunders from the New Orleans Saints for veteran center Luke Fortner, sources confirmed.
Saunders produced one of the best highlights of 2024
titles: Sources: Jaguars acquire DT Saunders from Saints
Saints trade DT Khalen Saunders to Jaguars in exchange for center Luke Fortner, per report
summary: The Jacksonville Jaguars have traded veteran center Luke Fortner to the New Orleans Saints in exchange for veteran defensive tackle Khalen Saunders. This player exchange was confirmed by multiple sources. Saunders, noted for creating one of the top highlights of 2024, will now be contributing to the Jaguars' defensive lineup.

title: Monsoon Rains in Country Claim 600 Lives; More Rain, Landslides Expected
snippets: Authorities have warned of more deluges and possible landslides between now and Tuesday. Heavy monsoon rains have lashed the country since June and killed more than 600.
Residents accuse officials of not warning them to evacuate as torrential rain and cloudbursts trigger deadly flooding.
titles: Pakistan defends flood response after over 270 people killed in northwestern district
At least 337 killed in Pakistan floods, gov’t defends emergency response
summary: Heavy monsoon rains have struck the country since June, causing over 600 deaths. Authorities now warn of further heavy rainfall and potential landslides through Tuesday. Amidst the devastation, residents have criticized officials for failing to issue evacuation warnings in response to the torrential rain and sudden cloudbursts that have led to deadly flooding.

title: Joey Aguilar Named Tennessee's Starting QB After Multiple Transfers
snippets: Joey Aguilar was named Tennessee's starting quarterback Sunday, beating out redshirt freshman Jake Merklinger for the job.
Aguilar transferred from App State to UCLA in the winter and then from UCLA to Tennessee in the spring
titles: Vols name Aguilar starting QB after Iamaleava exit
Joey Aguilar named Tennessee's starting QB: UCLA transfer takes over after departure of Nico Iamaleava
summary: Joey Aguilar has been named Tennessee's starting quarterback, securing the position over redshirt freshman Jake Merklinger. Aguilar's journey to this role involved transfers from App State to UCLA in the winter, and then from UCLA to Tennessee in the spring, before ultimately winning the starting quarterback job.

title: Omaha Mavericks' Deng Mayar Dies in Drowning Incident
snippets: Omaha Mavericks forward Deng Mayar, who transferred from North Dakota this offseason, died Saturday in a drowning incident.
Mayar transferred to Omaha this offseason from North Dakota
titles: Omaha forward Mayar dies in drowning incident
Omaha basketball player Deng Mayar dies at 22 in drowning accident
summary: Omaha Mavericks forward Deng Mayar, who recently transferred from North Dakota, tragically passed away in a drowning incident on Saturday. Mayar had joined the Omaha team this offseason. The circumstances surrounding his death are under investigation, and the university and basketball community are mourning his loss.

This comprehensive analysis provides enthusiasts with insights and recommendations to inform their draft preparations.

title: Oscar-Nominee Terence Stamp, Iconic Actor, Dies
snippets: The English actor was best known for starring as the arch-villain in the original Superman films and for depicting the title character in Billy Budd.

Family says actor who worked with William Wyler, Pier Paolo Pasolini and Steven Soderbergh, ‘leaves behind an extraordinary body of work’

  • Terence Stamp: a life in pictures
titles: Terence Stamp, '60s British film legend and star of 'Superman,' dies at 87
Terence Stamp, face of 60s British cinema and star of The Limey and Superman, dies at 87
summary: Terence Stamp, an Oscar-nominated actor renowned for his roles in the 1960s and his portrayal of General Zod in the "Superman" films, has passed away. With a career spanning six decades, Stamp collaborated with directors like William Wyler, Pier Paolo Pasolini, and Steven Soderbergh. His family highlighted his "extraordinary body of work" in their announcement, marking the loss of a significant figure in the film industry.

title: Akie Iwai Wins First LPGA Tour at Portland Classic, Matches Twin's Achievement
snippets: Akie Iwai joined twin sister Chisato as a rookie LPGA Tour winner Sunday at Columbia Edgewater, closing with a 6-under 66 for a four-stroke victory in The Standard Portland Classic.
Akie Iwai joined twin sister Chisato as a rookie LPGA Tour winner Sunday at Columbia Edgewater, closing with a 6-under 66 for a four-stroke victory in The Standard Portland Classic.
titles: Akie Iwai wins Portland Classic for first LPGA Tour title
Japanese rookie Akie Iwai captures LPGA Tour’s Portland Classic
summary: Akie Iwai secured her first LPGA Tour victory at the Standard Portland Classic, matching her twin sister Chisato's achievement. She finished with a 6-under 66, clinching a four-stroke win at Columbia Edgewater. This marks a significant milestone for the rookie golfer, highlighting her talent and potential in the professional golfing world.

title: Navarro Criticizes India's Russian Oil Buys, Calls Them Corrosive
snippets: His comments come shortly after trade negotiations between the U.S. and India were reportedly called off.

The dramatic increase in India’s purchases of Russian oil since the invasion of Ukraine is “opportunistic and deeply corrosive” of a global effort to isolate the Kremlin and curb Vladimir Putin’s war machine, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro wrote in the Financial Times.
titles: Trump advisor Peter Navarro slams India’s ‘opportunistic’ purchases of Russian crude
Trump Trade Adviser Navarro Slams India for Buying Russian Oil
summary: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro criticized India's significant rise in Russian oil purchases since the Ukraine invasion as "opportunistic and deeply corrosive," undermining global efforts to isolate Russia. This statement followed the cancellation of U.S.-India trade negotiations.

Anthony Kim and Henrik Stenson were relegated out of the LIV Golf League. Rahm's repeat victory secured his title, while Kim and Stenson faced relegation due to their performance.

title: Trump and Putin Discuss Ukraine Peace, Agree on NATO-Style Guarantees
snippets: Rubio, who is also Trump's national security adviser, said he did not believe issuing new sanctions on Russia would force Putin to accept a ceasefire.

NEW YORK (AP) — Russian leader Vladimir Putin agreed at his summit with President Donald Trump that the United States and its European allies could offer Ukraine a security guarantee resembling NATO’s collective defense mandate as part of an eventual deal to end the war, a U.S. official said Sunday.
titles: Putin agreed to let US, Europe offer NATO-style security protections for Ukraine, Trump envoy says
Putin agrees that US, Europe could offer NATO-style security guarantees to Ukraine, Trump envoy says
summary: During a summit in Alaska, President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin discussed ending the war in Ukraine. Putin agreed to let the U.S. and EU offer Ukraine NATO-style security guarantees, a significant move toward a potential peace deal. However, Trump's national security adviser, Rubio, expressed skepticism about the effectiveness of new sanctions on Russia to promote a ceasefire. This development marks a major step in diplomatic efforts to resolve the 3 1/2-year conflict in Ukraine.

title: Scottie Scheffler Wins BMW Championship, Marks Fifth PGA Title of Year
snippets: Scheffler's latest remarkable shot resulted in a huge payday and some PGA Tour history, too

Scottie Scheffler erased a four-shot deficit in five holes and then delivered a haymaker on the daunting par-3 17th by chipping in from 82 feet for birdie that carried him to victory Sunday in the BMW Championship for his fifth PGA Tour title of the year.
titles: WATCH: Scottie Scheffler ridiculous hole out clinches BMW Championship 2025, history alongside Tiger Woods
Scottie Scheffler rallies to win BMW Championship after highlight-reel chip
summary: Scottie Scheffler won the BMW Championship, overcoming a four-shot deficit in just five holes. His victory was highlighted by an 82-foot chip-in for birdie on the par-3 17th hole, marking his fifth PGA Tour title this year. This win not only secured a significant payday for Scheffler but also etched his name into PGA Tour history.

title: Ukraine and Russia Advance Military Drones for Combat and Scouting
snippets: While Ukraine has been developing hundreds of "iron soldiers" for combat, evacuation, and scouting, Russia is testing its own ground-based drones too.
titles: Russia is experimenting in Ukraine's robot war with uncrewed rocket launchers, hoverboards, and a box on wheels
summary: Ukraine is actively developing "iron soldiers," which are drones for combat, evacuation, and scouting purposes. Simultaneously, Russia is also conducting tests on its ground-based drones. This development indicates an ongoing effort by both nations to enhance their military capabilities through unmanned systems.

title: Gas Prices Drop Before Trump-Zelenskiy Meeting Amid Ukraine Peace Talks
snippets: European natural gas prices fell to a fresh 2025 low ahead of US President Donald Trump’s meeting with Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskiy, who faces pressure to reach a peace deal with Russia that involves ceding territory.
titles: European Gas Falls to New 2025 Low Before Zelenskiy-Trump Talks
summary: European natural gas prices dropped to their lowest level since 2025 before a scheduled meeting between US President Donald Trump and Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy. The meeting comes as Zelenskiy is under pressure to negotiate a peace agreement with Russia, which may include giving up territory.

title: European Stocks Mixed as Traders Eye Trump Meeting on Ukraine Situation
snippets: European stocks opened in mixed territory on Monday as traders focus on a meeting between regional leaders and President Trump to discuss Ukraine.
titles: European stocks trade mixed ahead of Trump-Ukraine crunch talks
summary: European stocks showed mixed performance at the opening on Monday. Traders are closely watching a meeting between regional leaders and President Trump to address the situation in Ukraine. The outcome of the meeting and its impact on the markets remain uncertain.

title: Companies Return to Traditional Hiring Amid AI Concerns
snippets: In a hiring process exhausted by AI, it's time to apply to jobs like it's 1999. Old-school paper resumes and in-person interviews are back.
titles: Paper résumés, trick questions, in-person job interviews: Hiring is going old school to escape AI slop
summary: In response to challenges posed by AI in hiring processes, there has been a shift back towards traditional methods. Companies are increasingly valuing paper resumes and in-person interviews, reminiscent of practices common in 1999. This change aims to enhance the recruitment experience by focusing on more personal and direct methods of assessment.

title: "Quiet Cracking" Trend Sees Workers Turning to AI for Career Advice
snippets: A new trend is quiet cracking. People at work are silently feeling stuck. What are they to do? One path involves getting advice from AI. Here's the AI Insider scoop.
titles: New Quiet Cracking Trend About People In The Workplace Gets Uncracked By AI Providing Mental Health Support
summary: A growing trend, termed "quiet cracking," involves individuals feeling stagnated in their careers but not openly discussing these challenges. To navigate this, some are turning to AI for guidance, seeking insights on potential solutions. This approach represents a modern strategy for addressing professional dissatisfaction.

title: Dr. Johnson Publishes Pet Safety Tips in Veterinary Journal
snippets: Dr. Jake Johnson, cardiology resident at North Carolina State University's College of Veterinary Medicine, is the author of a recent article published in Frontiers in Veterinary Science. Here, he discusses his findings and how to protect pets from future accidents.

summary: Dr. Jake Johnson, a cardiology resident at North Carolina State University's College of Veterinary Medicine, authored an article in Frontiers in Veterinary Science on protecting pets from accidents. His research offers insights and preventative measures for pet owners to safeguard their animals. The article is a contribution to veterinary science with a focus on accident prevention for pets.

title: UC Berkeley Advances Methane Tracking with CRISPR Technology
snippets: Roughly two-thirds of all atmospheric methane, a potent greenhouse gas, comes from methanogens. Tracking down which methanogens in which environment produce methane with a specific isotope signature is difficult, however. UC Berkeley researchers have for the first time CRISPRed the key enzyme involv
titles: Scientists just found a hidden factor behind Earth’s methane surge
summary: UC Berkeley researchers have successfully used CRISPR technology on the key enzyme of methanogens, organisms responsible for producing about two-thirds of atmospheric methane, a significant greenhouse gas. This breakthrough allows for the first-time identification of specific methanogens in various environments based on their methane's isotope signature. This advancement could improve understanding and tracking of methane emissions.

title: Study Reveals Herbivores Eat More Than Just Grass
titles: DNA Evidence Reveals Herbivores Eat Far More Than Just Grass
summary: DNA evidence has shown that herbivores consume a broader range of foods than previously thought, not just grass. This new understanding comes from a study analyzing the diet of animals like bison, revealing they also eat flowers and other plants. This research provides insights into the dietary habits of herbivores, expanding our knowledge of their feeding behaviors.

title: Exploring the Path to Self-Forgiveness: Strategies and Benefits
titles: Why Forgiving Yourself Is So Hard and How to Finally Do It
summary: A recent article on SciTechDaily discusses the challenges of self-forgiveness and offers insights into overcoming them. It explains why many people find it hard to forgive themselves, attributing the difficulty to internalized guilt and high personal standards. The article provides strategies for self-forgiveness, emphasizing the importance of acknowledging mistakes, understanding one's own humanity, and the process of healing. This piece aims to guide individuals on a path to forgiving themselves, highlighting the mental health benefits of doing so.

title: Extinct Shelduck Species Discovered on Chatham Islands
snippets: Scientists have uncovered an extinct shelduck from the Chatham Islands that evolved shorter wings and stronger legs, adapting to a predator-free, windy environment. It vanished before the 19th century, likely due to hunting and predation.
titles: Scientists uncover the lost shelduck that chose walking over flight
summary: Scientists discovered an extinct species of shelduck on the Chatham Islands, which evolved with shorter wings and stronger legs to adapt to a windy, predator-free habitat. This bird species disappeared before the 19th century, likely as a result of human hunting and new predators introduced to the islands.

title: Rising CO₂ May Intensify Satellite Drag During Geomagnetic Storms
snippets: Rising CO₂ levels will make the upper atmosphere colder and thinner, altering how geomagnetic storms impact satellites. Future storms could cause sharper density spikes despite lower overall density, increasing drag-related challenges.
titles: The surprising way rising CO2 could supercharge space storms
summary: Increasing CO₂ levels are expected to cool and thin the upper atmosphere, affecting geomagnetic storm interactions with satellites. This change may lead to more pronounced density spikes during storms, despite a general decrease in atmospheric density, potentially heightening drag-related issues for satellites.
